The loser of a ROUND may elect to either: (a) increase the total number of pips on his die by ONE by replacing one of its faces, or (b) have the winner decrease the total number of pips on his die by ONE by replacing one of its faces (winner's choice of face). In a multiplayer game, losers engage in a single roll-off to determine who gets to choose, with the LOSER winning that right.
A GAME lasts until one player has won six* ROUNDs.
A MATCH lasts until one player has won three* GAMEs.
Between GAMEs, each player must build a new custom D6 whose pips add up to no more than 21.


* This number may be reduced to shorten the game if more than two are playing.

For information on the interesting properties of custom D6 dice, search the Internet for 'Sicherman Dice' and 'Non-Transitive Dice'.

videogame.90542: Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 2

76697.name: Gauntlet (1985)

videogamehonor.29106: 1986 Golden Joystick Best Arcade-Style Game of the Year Nominee

videogamecompilation.90542: Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Atari Collection 2

76697.description:
Gauntlet is the name of a fantasy-themed hack and slash 1985 arcade game by Atari Games. It is noted as the first class-based multi-player game. Released during the emergence of popularity of other role-playing games like Dungeons & Dragons, the game was a sensation, being one of the first true dungeon crawl arcade games.

The players, up to four at once in the arcade version, select among four playable fantasy-based characters; Thor the Warrior, Merlin the Wizard, Thyra the Valkyrie or Questor the Elf. Each character has his or her own unique strength and weaknesses. For example, the Warrior is strongest in hand-to-hand combat, the Wizard has the strongest magic, the Valkyrie has the greatest armour and the Elf is the fastest in movement.

Source: Wikipedia, "Gauntlet (arcade game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76698.name: Nain
76698.description:
User Summary: A Kickstarter project for Reign available for free on the web.

Publisher Blurb:

NAIN is a complete, fully laid out miniature setting for the REIGN roleplaying game ( http://www.gregstolze.com/reign/ ). If the ransom is met, I'll release the PDFs onto the internet, for free, in perpetuity.

Inspired by JK Rowling, Fritz Leiber and Gormenghast, Nain is a kingdom dominated by wizards. Any family could have an enchanter born into it, waiting to be swept into one of the three great schools to harness his power.

The supplement contains...

A description of the nation, its tragic history, and its uncertain future.
Descriptions of enchantment's peculiar monsters, with an easy One-Roll system for generating more.
Company stats for the great families of wizardry, their hidden rivals, and the secretive cabals that pursue magical enlightenment... or the darkest of blasphemies.
A redesigned magic system, built from the ground up to provide flexibility, uncertainty, and character focus. Knowledge is the spark of sorcery, but passion is the fuel.




If you're a long-time REIGN fan, NAIN presents an entirely new setting. If you're just getting started with Enchiridion there's no better way to see the system at work.

76699.description:
The system is like the system of Dominion. It's called "Deck building".

The player is the commander. The object is a player collect the territory card by using a partner card and a mobile suit card.
The difference of Dominion is a player has a partner and a mobile suit on the front. This cards are able to use any own turn. And the territory card is added as the more point card.

The mobile suits and characters are from Mobile Suit Gundam: One year war and Mobile Suit Gundam: Char's Counterattack.

This will be sold as only preorder in Japan.
76699.name: Deckbuild Mobile Suit Gundam

76700.name: Combined Arms
76700.description:
This game is a tactical class game that reproduces the game against modern armored after the 1980's. The appearance forces are the tanks, the infantryman, and the fighting tank helicopters. The unit is one unit, and one basically vehicle. The unit is one platoon. In Advance game, the instruction rule by the commander is added. The participation war potential is Japan, the United States, Britain, West Germany, the Soviet Union, and Israel. The game can participate from 2 to about 6 people.


Basic Game Order of Play:
1.First player selection Phase
2.First player Movement Phase
3.Both Side Fire Phase
4.Second Player Movement Phase
5.Both Side Fire Phase

Advance Game Order of Play:
1.Both Players of assaulting first decision Phase
2.Recovery Phase
3.First Player selection Phase
4.Second Player evasion movement Phase
5.First Player Suppression Fire Phase
6.First player Movement Phase
7.Both Side Fire Phase
8.Second Player Suppression Fire Phase
9.Second Player Movement Phase
10.Both Side Fire Phase


Scale:
1turn=45 seconds
Hex=150m
Unit=One platoon


Components
1xRulebook
4xMaps(200mmx550mm)
8xChart
1000xCounters

76701.name: Discovery Garden

boardgameversion.52471: I can do that games edition

76701.description:
From the Publisher's Press Release "Welcome to a whimsical garden of fun and adventure. Flip over a card to reveal what colorful bug, lost tool, or buried heirloom needs to be found. Then spin the spinner and peek below one of five secret locations — from the melon patch or flower field to the fruit orchard or vegetable garden. Do you see a match? If you spin "mix the soil", watch out! You'll shake the box and the treasures will slide and hide in new locations. Find the most treasures to win!"

CONTENTS:
1 Shake-and-Look Box with 5 puzzle-piece doors (21 treasure pieces and 4.94 oz. (140g) of “soil” sealed inside)
1 Spinner
29 Cards
1 Game Rules Manual

76702.name: Richard Scarry's Busytown Cars and Trucks Card Game

boardgameversion.52473: I Can Do That Games Edition

76702.description: From the Publisher's Website "The whimsical world of Richard Scarry's Busytown comes to life in this colorful game of counting and comparison. Large oversized cards, perfect for little hands, feature familiar characters and silly vehicles from the Richard Scarry's classic book "Cars and Trucks and Things That Go." Each card has a colorful number from 1 to 12, designed especially for beginning counters. Each player flips over a card and the player with the most passengers wins the cards! But watch out, fun road hazards and special bonus cards create surprising twists!"

76703.name: The Cat in the Hat: What's In the Cat's Hat? Game

boardgameversion.52475: I Can Do That Games Edition

76703.description:
From the publisher's website "The Cat in the Hat has something mysterious in his hat! Can you guess what it is? In this fun, multisensory exploration game, one player hides a household object of their choice inside the hat and the other players use questions, clues, and the hat's fun interactive exploratory features to discover what it is. Is it something we eat? What room does it belong in? Not sure? Try feeling the hat with your elbows, poking your finger through a hole, or looking at the object through the magic crystalline window. Children will enjoy hours of creative fun with this innovative game!"

CONTENTS:
1 Hat
32 Exploration Cards
1 Game Rules Manual

76705.name: One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish Memory Game

boardgameversion.52477: I Can Do That Games Edition

76705.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

"Come along for a seashore adventure! What will you find hidden below the sand? Flip a card to reveal your challenge. Search for colorful fish, silly Seussian objects and other sea treasures hidden below 5 secret beach locations. But watch out for waves! If the game spinner lands on the wave, shake the box and the treasures will slide and hide in new locations. Find the most treasures to win!"

CONTENTS:
1 Shake-and-Look Box with 5 puzzle-piece doors (21 treasure pieces and “sand” 4.94 oz. (140g) sealed inside)
1 Spinner
29 Cards
1 Game Rules Manual.

76707.name: Me & My Katamari

videogamefranchise.6399: The Best (Best Selling PlayStation Games, JP)

76707.description:
[From the back of the box]

The King and the Prince are back in all their brilliance!

Take the adventure on the road as the Prince or one of his cousins, rolling up objects to create islands for a community of homeless animals. Featuring fun gameplay and a wonderfully varied soundtrack.

ALL NEW CONTENT
Enjoy new cousins, presents and levels.

2-4 PLAYER WIRELESS BATTLE
Take on your friends in exciting rolling battles.

76708.name: The Sims 2: Castaway

videogamefranchise.6403: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)

76708.description:
The Sims 2: Castaway is the third console spin-off of the video game The Sims 2. It was released in the United States on October 22, 2007 and October 26, 2007 in the United Kingdom for the Nintendo DS, Wii, PlayStation 2 and PlayStation Portable. The Sims 2: Castaway is offered on mobile platforms. Mobile manufacturer, Nokia offers The Sims 2: Castaway from the Ovi Store. The Sims Castaway Stories is a similar game created for personal computers.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Sims 2: Castaway," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76709.name: Home Made / Homebrew Villains + NPCs
76709.description:
user description

GMs, do you have a favorite Villain, Black Hat, Big Bad Evil Guy (BBEG)? Have you a great story about how one of your evil creations upstaged the famous Frankenstein's Monster? How about a memorable Non-Player Character which your players continue to retell stories about years later?

This entry is for all of us who have created a cool being within an adventure or campaign. And for those of us who wish to create just such an addition for a future gaming session.

Add images of your creations, discuss what made them memorable or what works and what doesn't work. Let the creative juices flow.

76710.name: Blazing Angels II: Secret Missions of WWII
76710.description:
User Summary:
This arcade-style flight simulator features aircraft created during the second world war, but which saw little or no use due to production issues or late design. The game also features a number of less-realistic weapons for the time period, such as a sound-seeking missle and a tesla coil.

The single player storyline features the adventures of the Blazing Angels, a squadron consisting of the player and three wingmen. Missions take the squadron to Egypt, Moscow, China, the Himalayas, and Rome, and include a variety of aerial and ground targets. Multiplayer features a co-op mode, and a vs. mode, pitting player squadrons against the AI or each other.

From the packaging:
"Fly the greatest aircraft you never knew existed!
Go up against a giant German Zepplin over the pyramids of Cairo.
Engage in 18 high-stakes missions where you'll bomb bridges, steal secret weapons, and more.
Pilot over 50 authentic planes and prototypes in some of the world's most exotic locations.

76711.name: Home Made / Homebrew Creatures
76711.description:
User Description

Are Dragons not enough? Tired of PCs always pulling out lit torches at the first sign of a Troll? I'm sure you are. That's why you created a beast your players have never seen before. Something to make them take pause and even cringe with fear.

This entry is for all of us who have created a vicious or cuddly beast to fill the fauna of your campaign world.

Add images of your creations, discuss what works and what doesn't work. Let the creative juices flow.

76712.name: Guitar Hero: Aerosmith
76712.description:
User Summary:
Utilizing the Guitar Hero III engine, GH: Aerosmith features 25 of the band's greatest hits, in addition to a number of other rock tracks. Single player is generally advanced by playing two of the other songs, followed by a trio of Aerosmith songs.

From the packaging:
"Rise to Rock Royalty
Rise to Rock Royalty with Guitar Hero: Aerosmith and rock out and jam on stage like you never have before with Aerosmith's authentically captured legendary moves. Play the best Rock & Roll tracks of all time including Aerosmith's greatest hits and chart-topping singles from some of the world's best bands.

Features:
Aerosmith's Greatest Hits of All Time: Over 25 Aerosmith master tracks, featuring an original song by Joe Perry.
Rock Out the Aerosmith Way: Perform in all-new venues and rise to greatness from Aerosmith's firt concert at Nipmuc High School to the halftime show at the Big Game.

Exclusive Behind-the-Scenes Interviews with Aerosmith."

76713.name: Franklin's Sea
76713.description:
Simple Age of Sail tactical naval miniatures war game with an alternate history twist (and alternate physics and geography). Includes instructions for simple model construction, scenarios, etc. Designed to be played on the front of your refrigerator, but there's no reason it can't be used for evocative fast play AWI/Napoleonic naval war on a horizontal surface.

In Franklin's Sea Columbus actually sailed off the edge of the world. There being no new world, Ben Franklin was undistracted by politics and discovered not only electricity, but fantastic secrets about the Earth's magnetic field that would allow the new copper-bottomed ships to sail safely over the edge of the world and down the ocean on the side. This began a new age of exploration and exploitation, and literally new horizons.

Players command naval groups of two to six ships sailing and fighting on a vertical surface. Movement rules include wind direction and handling differences between different classes of ships, as well as drifting down the sea, of course. Ships are rated for broadside dice and boarding dice. Range reduces firepower. The effects of damage are noted right on the simple record sheet for easy reference. With lucky rolls enemy ships can strike very quickly, or they may be beaten down with many shots. A ship that loses all its sails will be unable to resist drifting downward toward the abyss...

Game stats and construction plans included for 18 gun sloop of war, 44 gun frigate, 74 gun ship of the line, and 500 ton merchantman. Three scenarios included, two quite asymmetrical and one straightforward shoot 'em up with multiple large ships.

Simple but pleasing ship models are constructed from craft sticks, paper clips, paper, glue, etc with ordinary tools and glue.

(author's note)

76715.description: (Original title: Приключения на луне) The goal of the game is to rescue a lost spaceship on the moon and bring it back to the lunar base. It consists of two parts. During the first part, players roll dice to land on different locations on the moon map, collecting points for doing so. Some of the locations may have the lost spaceship. As soon as the lost spaceship is rescued, everyone moves back to the base, collecting additional points along the way. This game is mostly luck but features an accurate lunar map and encourages players to learn lunar locations and some noteworthy lunar missions.
76715.name: Adventures on the moon

76717.name: Monopoly: Barça
76717.description:
RESUMEN DEL JUEGO

Monopoly Barça is them game of buy, lease or sell football players. The winner is the game player most rich at the end of the game.
From the Start box, the pawns are moved around the board the same number of boxes than the dice roll. When a player moves to an empty box, can buy it at the bank. If is not interested, the Bank proceeds to an auction. When a player moves to a property of another player, must pay a rent, the rent is bigger if in the box are "Copas de la Liga" (League championships) or Champions League trophys. When a player moves to the boxes SPORT o AGRUPACIÓ MUTUA, he takes a card and follow his instrucions.
(From the "Introduction")

76718.name: Toymallet 40¢
76718.description:
"Welcome to the world of totally cheap tabletop wargaming! Why spend buckets of cash on a superior, worthwhile product when you can download this crappy cheap ass parody of Warhammer 40K? Now you too can roll fistfulls of dice to see who split whos testicles open on the bloody field of battle, otherwise known as the kitchen table. Now, you too can have no life and be the sort of nerd who even furries snicker at: a grognard, a wargamer. This and more is all yours for cheap as free with TOYMALLET 40 Cents!"

(from author's webpage)

Beneath the parody, this is a simple but playable miniatures wargame. Two players take turns moving, shooting, and assaulting with their miniatures armies, which can be made from almost any kind of miniatures or toys. Everything is fitted into three broad categories (squads, commanders, and tankmecha), with some options for further characterization by special rules (extra armour, flight capability, etc). All combat is resolved by rolling six-sided dice, and all measurement is in terms of Lengths (any length unit the players agree on - the game accomodates miniatures of any scale if you chose a sensible length of a Length). The winner is the side that after six turns have accumulated the most Happy Time Fun points, which are earned for seizing objectives and killing enemies.

76719.name: Squadron UK - Basic!
76719.description:
From the website:

This book contains all the rules you need to play Squadron UK and it's FREE. There are no examples or scenarios so its best read by experienced role-players. Three of the more complex Superpowers are missing as are some of the character development rules but the game detailed here is fully playable.

76720.name: God of War: Chains of Olympus

videogamefranchise.6404: Greatest Hits (Best Selling PlayStation Games, US)

videogamehonor.31830: 2007 Game Critics Best Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

76720.description:
God of War: Chains of Olympus is an action-adventure game developed by Ready at Dawn for the PlayStation Portable and prequel to God of War. Loosely based on Greek mythology and focused on protagonist Kratos, the game forms part of a saga - the God of War series - with revenge as a central theme. In this chapter, Kratos opposes the goddess Persephone (who allies the god Morpheus and Titan Atlas) in her attempt to destroy the world and Mount Olympus.

The game is similar to other installments in the series, and is a third-person action adventure game containing quick time events, box-based puzzles and boss fights.

Kratos' weapons includes the trademark "Blades of Chaos" and new weapons the Sun Shield and Gauntlet of Zeus. New magical abilities include the use of an Efreet; the "Light of Dawn" and "Charon's Wrath". Health and Magic upgrades - Gorgon Eyes and Phoenix Feathers respectively - reappear in addition to normal Health and magic-giving chests.

In addition to an array of normal opponents (such as soldiers; harpies; gorgons and the cyclops), major foes include a Persian King, a giant basilisk, the ferryman of the dead Charon and the goddess Persephone.

Source: Wikipedia, "God of War: Chains of Olympus," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76721.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Tactics
76721.description:
Dungeons & Dragons Tactics is a tactical role-playing game released on the PlayStation Portable handheld video game console. It is set in the world of Dungeons & Dragons and uses a strict interpretation of the Dungeons & Dragons 3.5 Edition rule set.

In the campaign storyline, players lead a party of adventurers on their quest to investigate an ancient being, about which little beyond the name is initially known. The plot is eventually revealed to be an epic contest between two dragons competing for godhood. The player can choose the path of good or evil, with different quests available depending on which is preferred, although the distinction between the two is not always clear. The game is divided up into a number of distinct battles or missions (30+), with the player able to access the majority of these during a given campaign, since several of the scenarios are mutually exclusive. Scenarios cannot be re-played once successfully completed.

The campaign revolves around a single lead character, with the other characters playing a supporting role. At the start of each scenario or battle, players select which additional adventurers to take along (up to a total of five such auxiliary characters after the first few scenarios). While this technically allows one to have more than six adventurers, only characters who actually participate in a given battle earn experience, so attempting to field a larger stable of cohorts serves to dilute earned experience levels.

The game features the core character classes from the D&D rulebook: the Barbarian, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Monk, Paladin, Ranger, Rogue, Sorcerer, and Wizard, as well as two non-core classes, the Psion and Psychic Warrior. A full set of character generation rules permit players to create their own characters, or use pre-generated characters selected from a "character library".

Source: Wikipedia, "Dungeons & Dragons Tactics," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76722.name: Call of Cthulhu Quick-Start Rules
76722.description:
From the introduction:

"Horror. Terror. Fear is at the core of our existence. Horror stories are a catharsis for the dread we hold in our souls on a day-to-day level. Call of Cthulhu is a game that lets you explore that fear, bringing monsters and terrors out into daylight, and fighting against them for the sake of soul and sanity. ... The booklet you now hold in your hands gives you all the information you will need to create a character for the Call of Cthulhu roleplaying game, as well as a brief overview on how to play the game."

Includes the introductory adventure "The Haunting." Available with b&w or color cover.

rpgitemversion.238296: Lulu black & white POD softcover version

76724.name: Slasher Flick: The Director's Cut
76724.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Does the idea of running through the woods while being chased by a maniac in a hockey mask sound like fun to you? Or how about having your dreams invaded by a vile, demonic entity looking to slash you limb from limb? How about trying to survive a night of babysitting while an eerie white-masked individual is after you?

Okay, so perhaps these don't sound that appealing in real life, but they're a blast when they happen in a role-playing game. That's what Slasher Flick is all about!

Slasher Flick: the Director's Cut is more than just a cute play on words... it's a deluxe version of the Slasher Flick core rulebook. Everything you could ever need is found in this product.

Full color interior pages
Full-sized 8.5" by 11" book (as opposed to the digest-sized original).
All-new cover
Never-before-seen material designed to improve the game and make it more user-friendly.
Material culled from the various supplements, including 100 character templates, additional special rules for characters, group archetypes and much more.
Three "quick flicks" that allow you to get a game up and running in no time.
A spine-tingling 23-page introductory adventure called, "The Vault".

76725.name: Escape from Venu
76725.description:
An Introductory Adventure for
Starblazer Adventures: Mindjammer

Download available from official Website
http://www.cubicle-7.com/starblazer/stardownloads.php

76726.name: Wild West Cinema
76726.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Wild West Cinema is the RPG of Wild West action... cinema style! Focusing less on historical accuracy, WWC aims to emulate the style of action found in the movies. Realism isn't completely disregarded, but the rules allow the characters to be daring, perform larger than life feats, make things happen and live long enough to ride off into the sunset as the credits roll. The players are the stars of all those spaghetti westerns and dime novels in a Wild West world you create.

So, pull on those boots, don that hat and mount that horse. It's time to ride!

76727.description:
Atlantis & Trisland is a full size, full color mounted expansion that folds to a size that will fit in both the Steam and Age of Steam boxes. While both maps are island based, they couldn’t be more different: Atlantis is an epic map focusing on the struggles of the island nation to somehow create a self-sustaining rail network that reaches the shore from a central hub of production, while Trisland is a 3-player-only map with elegant simplicity and symmetry.

Atlantis takes place on the mythical island of lore, where you’ll need to figure out how the giant city of Atlantia in the center of the island can reach the towns and cities along the coast. It’s expensive, production is very limited, and the competition is brutal. Atlantis was originally designed 5 years ago, but was deemed too harsh and unforgiving for even the bravest players...it was shelved and only recently picked up again and tweaked to make it slightly more friendly, with an emphasis on slightly. Bankruptcy or utter hopelessness is almost always just around the corner when playing this map. Atlantis is for 3-6 players who are comfortable seeing their opponents weep uncontrollably.

Trisland is the perfect 3 player map. By perfect, not only is gameplay streamlined and optimized for 3 players, but it is also perfectly symmetrical. Very few rule tweaks are included with the map, making this a perfect “classic” Steam/Age of Steam playing experience for three players. The rule changes that are present are specifically designed to address the shortcomings of Steam/Age of Steam when played with three players. Trisland is for 3 players, and 3 players only.

The 2010 Essen Aos/Steam map pack from Bezier Games features 7 new maps, including 6 mounted ones on 3 double size expansions. These maps can be preordered from www.beziergames.com and will ship in October 2010. The “bonus” 7th map is only available through preorders. Expansion #1: California Gold Rush & Underground Railroad as well as Expansion #2: Amazon Rainforest and Sahara Desert have been previously announced. Details about the remaining bonus pre-order only map will be coming in the next few weeks from Bezier Games.
76727.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Atlantis & Trisland

76728.description:
In every round of Freeze (aka Bühne frei!), four players enter the stage together and improvise a scene in a situation only they know. Each of them knows their personal rank among the actors (1-4), but no actor knows the rank of another. The actors must act out their rank within the scene so obviously that the spectators can guess it.

But do not fear: There is no need to have studied acting in order to win at Freeze. Just react to what the others are doing in the 45-second-long scene – or laugh yourselves away, no matter whether you are spectator or actor...
76728.name: Freeze

rpg.714: Cartoon Action Hour (Season One & Two Editions)

76729.name: Going Japanese
76729.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Going Japanese takes CAH:S2 into the exciting realms of anime. Written by Bryan Beyer and Colin Chapman, this product examines the various sub-genres of anime, all the while explaining how they can be replicated within context of the game. Plus, the bulk of the book is devoted to presenting three ready-to-run series: Massvor Prime, Alpha Wavetech and Hypermon: HyperCard Monsters/Hypermon: Invasion.

76730.name: Latina Facta & Versatile Performance Redux
76730.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Two PDF products in one! Latina Facta includes 15 new feats based on Latin sayings. Versatile Performance Redux introduces an alternate Versatile Performance class feature for bards that uses terminology related to acting, music, and dance to represent bardic talents.

76731.name: Star Ocean
76731.description:
[User Summary]

Star Ocean is a science-fiction RPG developed by tri-Ace and published by Enix for the Super Famicom. It was only released in Japan, but fan-made English translations have emerged in recent years.

A remake for the PSP, entitled Star Ocean: First Departure, was released in the United States on October 21, 2008, and in Europe on October 24, 2008.

The protagonist in Star Ocean is Ratix Farrence, a member of the Kratus Defense Force, which defends the town of Kratus. When a virus plagues a nearby town, Ratix and others go to search for a cure.

76732.name: 1943: The Battle of Midway
76732.description:
User Summary:
The sequel to arcade hit 1942, 1943: The Battle Of Midway features similar vertical scrolling shooter gameplay. Putting the players in control of a P-38 fighter, the game consists of 16 levels leading up to an attack on the Japanese battleship Yamato. Where the previous game provided multiple lives to each player, 1943 uses a hit point system with a single life per play.

76733.name: TeieLugu
76733.description:
Estonian erotic board game; is great for couples for getting to know each other a little better and this game is also a great party game as well. You can find out a lot more about your friends, their wishes and for sure you will hear a lot of stuff you have never heard before. And it doesn't matter how long you have been together, this game fits all.

The has very easy rules and moving is with dice.
You roll the dice and move on the heart shaped board. You get to the black space, you miss a turn. If you get to a space with ? on it, you get a card and do as it says. The last one to finish the game, will have to obey to the winner until the next game or all night long.
Enjoy.

76734.name: Star Raiders

videogameversion.139592: Android (Atari Greatest Hits Atari 2600 Emulation) edition

76734.description:
Star Raiders is a video game for the Atari 8-bit family of computers, released in 1979 and programmed by Doug Neubauer. It was also later ported to other Atari computer and game platforms. It was distinctive for its graphics, which (under most conditions) represented an out-the-cockpit, first-person view from a fictional combat spaceship traveling through a streaming 3D starfield in pursuit of enemy fighters called "Zylons". While there had already been simple target-shooting games using this perspective, Star Raiders had considerably higher quality graphics and more complex game play. As a result, it inspired both imitators throughout the 1980s and later-generation "space combat simulation" games such as the Wing Commander and X-Wing series. It is one of the games that inspired the seminal title Elite. It is also one in a series of first person space shooters (including 1977's Starhawk and 1979's Star Fire) that appeared in the late-1970s and were arguably predecessors of the later seen first-person shooter genre. The game's attract mode, a simple streaming star field, was a common sight in computer stores of the early-1980s to show off the Atari computers' graphics capabilities.

The 2600 console version of the game came packed with part 3 of the Atari Force comic series as done by DC Comics. The series would finish with Star Raiders, DC's first Graphic Novel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star_Raiders," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76735.name: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare: Mobilized
76735.description:
Call of Duty: Modern Warfare: Mobilized features the same first-person shooter gameplay found in its predecessors, Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare and Call of Duty: World at War. Mobilized includes new weapons and vehicles, new mini-games such as hacking computer terminals, and taking control of UAV spy drones and an AC-130 gunship.

Mobilized also features a six-person online multiplayer mode, including new features of games like Sabotage, where players fight to bring a bomb to opposing bases, also a Survival mode in which players must fend off waves of enemies at once, and Arcade mode, where players must complete the single-player campaign in a set time limit for points and unlockable achievements.

Mobilized has a new interface, improved controls and mobility. The AI was also improved, enemies take cover, they can charge with shotguns, pull back when the player enters the room, throw grenades, etc.

Source: Wikipedia, "Call of Duty: Modern Warfare: Mobilized," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76736.name: Star Raiders II
76736.description:
Star Raiders II is a video game released in 1986 for the Atari 8-bit home computers, and later several other home computers and game consoles. The game was originally developed as part of a tie-in with the movie The Last Starfighter, which featured an arcade game of the same name as part of its plotline. During development the tie-in was dropped, and the game converted into a sequel to Star Raiders by changing a number of gameplay elements. The gameplay remained quite different than the original Star Raiders. Versions with The Last Starfighter branding made their way into the warez channels.

Source: Wikipedia, "Star_Raiders_2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76737.name: Call of Duty: War Chest
76737.description:
[User Summary]

A compilation boxset for Windows comprising of the 3 Call of Duty titles: "Call of Duty", "Call of Duty: United Offensive" and "Call of Duty 2".

76738.name: Call of Duty: The War Collection
76738.description:
[User Summary]

A compilation boxset for Xbox 360 comprising of the 3 Call of Duty titles: "Call of Duty 2", "Call of Duty 3" and "Call of Duty: World at War".

videogame.75863: Call of Duty 2: Big Red One

76739.name: Call of Duty: Legacy

videogamecompilation.75863: Call of Duty 2: Big Red One

76739.description:
[User Summary]

A compilation boxset for Playstation 2 comprising of the 2 Call of Duty titles: "Call of Duty: Finest Hour" and "Call of Duty 2: Big Red One".

76741.description:
This first expansion for The Thing adds cards, a 5th & 6th player, new Encounters, specific Blood Testing of other players, and other ways to expand your adventures in Antarctica circa 1982; cards like: "I ain't going with Windows. I ain't going with him," "And everybody watch whoever you're with - real close," The Thing on the Ceiling, "If you are all these Things then you just attack me right now. So some of you are still human," and " This Thing doesn't want to show itself, it wants to hide inside an imitation." Also, a new mechanism has been added whereby up to 2 Outpost players that have been assimilated, may reveal their alien nature and actively work alongside the original Thing, against the remaining humans.

The 5 and 6-player game plays slightly differently, in that the Thing player does not draw 5 or 6 cards per turn - she draws 3 cards, but has 3 new elements with which to thwart and upset the Outpost players:

Bad Blood: Each turn, during the Blair-saucer phase, one player (chosen by the El Capitan) must put a card from their hand under the Bad Blood card. Failing to do so makes unpleasant things happen....

Thousand Miles to the Coast Like the Blair-saucer, this is a play-area objective, giving the Thing another path to victory. If the players ignore for too long the lone dog's run for the coast, they may very well find that humanity is in deadly peril of being assimilated.

Somebody blew a fuse in the lab: This can be a particularly harrowing encounter for the Outpost players, if they're not ready for it. During this stage of the game, infected-player-Things may have the opportunity to infect another Outpost player, unbeknownst to the others, while the lights are out...

Due to the cost of printing the number of cards required for the base 2-4 player game, it was decided to release the additional player cards as a separate card expansion. Most of the cards can be added straight into the decks for 2-4 player games - with only a handful of cards designed specifically for 5-6 player games.

Please note: This game is strictly for adults - with profanity and horrific imagery on many of the cards.
76741.name: The Things

76742.name: Out Run

videogamehonor.29109: 1987/1988 Golden Joystick Best Arcade-Style Game of the Year Winner

76742.description:
Out Run (アウトラン, Auto Ran?) (also spelled OutRun and Outrun) is a 1986 arcade game designed by Yu Suzuki and Sega-AM2. The game was a major hit with arcade-goers and is notable for its innovative hardware (including a moving cabinet), pioneering graphics and music, a choice in both soundtrack and route, and its strong theme of luxury and relaxation. In retrospective interviews, Yu Suzuki has classified Out Run not as a racing game, but as a "driving" game.

The game featured many innovations of both technology and gameplay. At the time of its release, the game was unique in that it was possible to choose the stages in which the race took place, save for the initial one. Before every checkpoint, there was a fork in the road, allowing the player to enter one of two different environments. (A similar branching system had been used once before in the 1983 Atari/Tatsumi racer TX-1.)

Source: Wikipedia, "Out_Run," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76743.name: Xenophobe
76743.description:
Xenophobe is a 1987 arcade game published by Bally Midway. Starbases, moons, ships, and space cities are infested with aliens, and the players have to kill the aliens before each is completely overrun.

This game was unusual in that it split the single monitor into three separate horizontal sections, one for each player. This allowed the players to cooperate, but also allowed the separate players to wander around freely, a feature not found on most cooperative multi-player games. With most games that allowed multiple players at once, all players were bound by the edges of the screen (that is, all the players had to be in the same general area on the screen, so it could contain them all). Because the game featured such high resolution for its time, the split screen didn't detract from the game's graphic appeal.

Source: Wikipedia, "Xenophobe_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76744.name: Xevious
76744.description:
Xevious (ゼビウス, Zebiusu?) (prounounced "Zeh-vee-us" or "Zee-vee-us") is a vertical scrolling shooter arcade game by Namco, released in 1982.[1] It was designed by Masanobu Endō. In the U.S., the game was manufactured and distributed by Atari. Xevious runs on Namco Galaga hardware.

The player uses an 8-way joystick to pilot a combat aircraft called a Solvalou, which is armed with a forward-firing "shooter" for aerial targets and a "bomber" which fires an unlimited supply of air-to-surface bombs for ground targets. The game, presumably set in Peru, was noted for the varied terrain below, which included forests, airstrips, bases, and mysterious Nazca Line-like drawings on the ground.

Source: Wikipedia, "Xevious," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76745.name: Family Feud 2010 Edition
76745.description: User summary: 2010 video game adaptation of the popular TV Game Show. Players take the part of contestants, attempting to guess what items people surveyed would answer to fit certain categories. Players win money for correct guesses and attempt to make it to the Play Fast Money round to compete for the largest prize.

76746.name: Kororinpa: Marble Mania
76746.description:
From the back cover:
Guide your marble to the goal by tilting, twisting, and rotating fun and frantic mazes with the Wii Remote!

User summary:
Similar to the classic arcade game Marble Madness, Kororinpa requires you to tilt the world to move your marble through a series of obstacles to the final goal. Doing well unlocks marbles with different characteristics and even unusual shapes.

76747.name: Harvest Moon: Tree of Tranquility
76747.description:
User summary:

The first game in the Harvest Moon series for the Wii maintains the popular elements of Harvest Moon, farming, cooking, fishing, raising animals, etc, but adds to it the functionality of the Wii Remote. The goal is to restore the tree of tranquility and return the prosperity of the Harvest Goddess to Waffle Island.

76748.name: Panic Bomber
76748.description:
"It is a "falling blocks" puzzle game based on the Bomberman franchise. The goal of the game is essentially to cause your opponent to lose by causing their gameplay field to fill to the top with objects. You do this by causing chains of bombs to explode, sending useless rubble over to your opponent's field, which they must then remove themselves. Bombs are earned by causing chains of three identical blocks to disappear. Bombs can only be blown up with an explosion from a lit bomb, which falls from the top of the screen every so often. If the player causes enough damage, they can eventually earn a giant bomb, which will remove a large amount of debris from the playing field, and cause their opponent a good deal of trouble.

The game's regular story mode revolves around Bomberman's hunt for the Golden Bomber statue. During his trek, he fights against several different odd characters, like Drifty the balloon, or Cecil the tiger. However, all that can really be earned from playing through this mode is a harder difficulty level, earned by finishing the entire story at the "hard" difficulty level. The player's progress is saved by a password system."

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bomberman:_Panic_Bomber," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76749.name: Hunt the Wumpus
76749.description:
Hunt the Wumpus is an early computer game, based on a simple hide and seek format featuring a mysterious monster (the Wumpus) that lurks deep inside a network of rooms. It was originally a text-based game written in BASIC. It has since been ported to various programming languages and platforms including graphical versions.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hunt_The_Wumpus,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76750.name: Zaxxon

videogamehonor.39312: 2003 Swedish Game Awards Game of the Year Winner

76750.description:
Zaxxon is a 1982 arcade game developed and released by Sega. Some sources claim that Japanese electronics company Ikegami Tsushinki also worked on the development of Zaxxon. The game gives the player the experience of flying a fighter craft through a fortress while shooting at enemy entities (missiles, enemy gunfire, etc.) The object of the game is to hit as many targets as possible without being shot down or running out of fuel—which can be replenished, paradoxically, by blowing up fuel drums.

At the time of its release, Zaxxon was unique as it was the first game to employ axonometric projection, which lent its name to the game (AXXON from AXONometric projection). The type of axonometric projection is isometric projection: this effect simulated three dimensions from a third-person viewpoint.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zaxxon," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76751.name: Gateway II: Homeworld
76751.description:
Five hundred thousand years ago, a technologically advanced race called the Heechee ruled the galaxy. Then they vanished. San Francisco 2112 A.D. A fanatic cult of terrorists plans to bring the Heechee's ancient enemy to Earth and purify humanity in a bath of cleansing fire. You must stop them, but you can't do it alone.

The race to stop these madmen catapults you on a journey to new worlds and new adventures and ultimately across the event horizon of a black hole where you discover mankind's last remaining hope for survival--the Heechee Homeworld.
-From the back of the CD jewel case: Publisher Blurb

76752.name: NHL Hitz 20-03
76752.description:
User Summary:

NHL Hitz is a high-adrenaline, arcade style hockey game developed by Midway Sports Home Entertainment. It features 3-on-3 gameplay with big hits and action, similar to other arcade sports games developed by Midway.

It was released on the Playstation 2, Xbox, Gamecube, and Game Boy Advance game systems.

76753.name: LostWinds
76753.description:
LostWinds is a platform/adventure video game developed by Frontier Developments for WiiWare. The game was released in North America on May 12, 2008 and in Europe on May 20, 2008, serving as a launch title for WiiWare in both regions.

The game revolves around a young boy named Toku tasked with saving his homeland from the vengeful elemental Balasar with guidance from the wind elemental Enril.

The player controls Toku, but simultaneously uses the Wii Remote to draw directional paths on-screen that control the wind. Wind is used to enhance Toku's jumps, defeat or immobilize enemies, and solve puzzles.[5] A second player can also join in with their Wii Remote controlling a second on-screen wind cursor, allowing Toku to fly farther but not higher.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lost Winds," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76754.name: The Seven Cities of Gold
76754.description:
The Seven Cities of Gold is an adventure game created by Dan Bunten (and the game development team Bunten founded, Ozark Softscape) and published by Electronic Arts in 1984. The player takes the role of a late-15th century explorer for Spain, setting sail to the New World in order to explore the map and interact with the natives in order to win gold and please the Spanish court. The name derives from the "seven cities" of Quivira and Cíbola that were said to be located somewhere in the American Southwest.

Source: Wikipedia, "The_Seven_Cities_of_Gold_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76755.name: Munch Man
76755.description:
Munch Man is a video game exclusively made for the TI-99 computer. It is a game that is similar to Pac-Man in that the player must cover an entire maze while be chased by 4 enemies. However, instead of eating dots from the maze, the player must cover it all in a chain which is produced as the player moves around the maze.

There are 4 pellets per stage that the player can eat which will make the enemies vulnerable. Running into an enemy will defeat it, and send it back to its home.

After each stage, the 4 enemies change shape to become different things. There are 20 enemy variations in all.

Source: User summary

76757.name: Passage
76757.description:
User summary

A 5-minute game by Jason Rohrer highlighting the difficult choices a person makes in the course of one lifetime. The game uses a 100×16 pixel screen and 8-bit style graphics. Passage may be downloaded for free.

76758.name: Repton
76758.description:
Repton is a British computer game originally developed by a then 15-year-old Tim Tyler for the BBC Micro and Acorn Electron and released by Superior Software in 1985.

The eponymous protagonist, Repton, is a lizard who crawls around an underground maze in a quest to find all the diamonds (some being held in safes, their release being triggered by finding and collecting a key) within a time limit in each of several levels, while avoiding being trapped or killed by falling rocks and monsters hatched from eggs.

Source: Wikipedia, "Repton_(video_game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76759.name: [PROTOTYPE]

videogamefranchise.6403: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.33161: 2010 CVA Best Console Game of the Year Nominee

76759.description:
The game is set in New York City, where a virulent plague is spreading through Manhattan. Those infected are mutated into hideous monsters. The United States Marine Corps, under the command of the black ops organization Blackwatch, is dispatched to contain it. At the center of it is the protagonist, Alex Mercer, a shapeshifter with no memory of his past. Alex has the ability to absorb other individuals, taking on their biomass, memories, experiences, and physical forms. Parallel to the game's storyline is the ability to play the game as a sandbox-style video game giving the player freedom to roam Manhattan.

Source: Wikipedia, "Prototype (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame.105392: Super Mario Bros. / Tetris / Nintendo World Cup

76760.name: Nintendo World Cup

videogamecompilation.105392: Super Mario Bros. / Tetris / Nintendo World Cup

76760.description:
User Summary:
Nintendo World Cup is a soccer game from the "Kunio-Kun" series of games from Technos Japan for the Famicom, NES, and Gameboy. It features up to 4 player local multiplayer (with the use of a multi-tap for the Famicom/NES). Players can choose from 13 different national teams.

Gameplay features simple pass/shoot mechanics, with the ability to perform a "special shot". This is done by either headbutting the ball or by performing a bicycle kick. A team is limited to a certain number of "special shots" per half.

There are no penalties/cards in the game. Players may slide tackle or elbow other players at will.

76761.name: Doodle Bomb
76761.description:
From the Publisher:

For millennia philosophers have predicted the rise of a hero who would restore balance to our chaotic world, but nobody predicted he would be a Doodle! Blast your way through 65 mind-bending physics puzzles as you guide your hero to the ultimate goal of Bomb Master. Interact with unique physics driven machines and characters who will help (or hurt) your attempt to infiltrate the enemy base using as few bombs as possible.

Do you have what it takes? Stretch out your finger and join the fight today!

76762.name: NES Four Score
76762.description:
The NES Four Score is a 4-player multi-tap controller adapter for the NES console. It features 4 standard plugs for controller input; a switch to choose between 2 and 4 players; and toggle buttons which put the "A" and/or "B" buttons into "Turbo" mode (simulating the button being pressed rapidly).

It uses up both controller ports on the main console.

76763.name: Wii Music
76763.description: From the back of the case: Creative! Fun! A music game that's for everyone! 60+ instruments. Strum, drum, and play using motions and more!

76764.name: Repton 2
76764.description:
The eponymous protagonist, Repton, is a lizard who crawls around an underground maze in a quest to find all the diamonds (some being held in safes, their release being triggered by finding and collecting a key.) There are also jigsaw puzzle pieces to collect, which eventually spell out the message "Repton 2 is ended".

There are no levels as such in Repton 2, instead 'transporters' move Repton between different screens which, subject to a number of restrictions, can be completed in any order desired. The entire game is in effect one very large level without passwords, meaning that it must be completed in one attempt.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Repton_%28video_game%29,"; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76765.name: We Ski
76765.description:
User Summary:

We Ski allows players to explore a skiing resort, ski down 14 different slopes with different levels of challenge as well as compete in various ski related competitions. Players can choose to ski at night or during the day in a variety of changing weather conditions. As you complete a slope, you are given a rank for the quality of your run (S+,S,A,B,C,D) in four different categories (Time, Turning, Balance and Speed). Completing all 14 slopes with S+ requires perfect runs and exceptional skill.

We Ski is notable as being the first 3rd party game released that makes use of the Wii Balance Board (and the second after Wii Fit).

76766.name: Babo Crash
76766.description:
From the Publisher:
The heroes and villains of the Babo universe unite to duke it out for high scores in a match 3 game! Collect gems and fight the Chompii infestation.

76767.name: The Last Guardian

videogamehonor.31273: 2011 Spike Most Anticipated Game Next Year Nominee

76767.description:
User Description

Upcoming release from Fumito Ueda and the rest of Team Ico, creators of Ico and Shadow of the Colossus. You take the role of a small boy leading around a giant mythical beast.

The Japanese title means "The man-eating giant eagle Trico".

76768.name: Commander Keen Complete
76768.description:
User Summary:

"Commander Keen Complete Pack" is a digital download release of all the Commander Keen games bundled together.

76771.name: NES Max
76771.description:
The NES Max is a first-party controller that was released by Nintendo in 1988.

The controller featured a "cycloid" in the center of an 8-direction D-Pad "ring." This simulated a joystick however it did not have analog response and was more of a way for a player to push the d-pad in a certain direction in a more fine-tuned manner.

It also featured 2 "turbo" buttons for A and B, which simulated the respective button being pushed in rapid succession.

76772.name: Pix 'n Love Rush
76772.description:
From the Publisher's website

Move, jump and shoot!

Sounds easy? Well it is at first... but wait and play!

All you love in classic Jump & Run games stuffed into 5 minute sessions where your heartbeat will not resist the Rush!

Infinity Mode for those of you who have solid nerves and good reflexes!
Worldwide score boards and tons of achievements. Can you get to the Top?
125 levels and 7 skins and more to come!

76773.name: PixelJunk Eden

videogamehonor.31117: 2008 Spike Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee

76773.description:
User Summary

The second game in the PixelJunk series of games on PSN, Eden is a 2D sidescrolling action game inspired by the classic 8-bit game "Bugaboo The Flea".

The player jumps & swings around an abstract shaded world, collecting pollen to unlock new plant growths to swing ever higher to reach several "Spectra" that are used to unlock new levels.

The game supports PSP Remote Play, allowing users to "play" it on a PS3 remotely through a PSP.

76774.name: Saving Private Sheep
76774.description:
From the Bulkypix Website

The War of the Sheep

General call-up (speech given by General Sheepard through the microphone of the B.B.Sheep)

The war between wolves and sheep is raging.

The wolves' territory is expanding from one day to the next, encroaching on our green pastures.

We must fight these bloody baaarbarians if we want to graze again in peace!

We will show the enemy that we are not lambs and that we will not be led to the slaughter in silence.

It is time to launch operation "Iron Wool"!

Help the woollen warrior conquer enemy territory by leading it into the secure zone.

To do this, you will need just one weapon: your finger!

Destroy the obstacles in the surrounding area to enable the sheep to achieve its objective in total safety.

Increasingly complex structures and special blocks (indestructible, explosive etc.) coming in a variety of shapes and with different actions will make your mission harder.

Saving Private Sheep offers accessible gameplay for any player, thanks to the progressive difficulty which is perfectly paced over more than 80 levels.

Combine logic, dexterity and strategy to achieve victory!

Will you manage to unlock the bonus levels, win the medals and achieve ultimate success in the game?

76775.name: Burn Zombie Burn!
76775.description:
User Summary

"Burn Zombie Burn", developed by the Kuju owned Double-Six studio, appears to be a simple top-down twin-stick shooter with a zombie theme, however it's a little deeper than first appearances make it look. Indeed, players do shoot up waves of zombies, however to achieve high scores, it's more about management of zombies by setting them on fire & using them to create combo chains.

"Burn Zombie Burn" is notable for being the first release partly funded by Sony's "Pub Fund" where they guarantee to match any funds put forward by the developer in royalties.

76776.name: IL-2 Sturmovik

videogamehonor.29716: 2002 D.I.C.E. Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee (Computer)

76776.description:
User Summary

IL-2 Sturmovik is a combat flight simulator that focuses on fun yet realistic game play. It is set on the Eastern Front and provides Early, Mid, and Late War campaigns for both the Russians and the Germans. The player may adjust the settings to as easy or realistic as they like.

videogame.140008: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Limited Edition Collector's Set

76777.name: Hillsfar
76777.description:
From the back of the box

HILLSFAR: A city in the magical FORGOTTEN REALMS game world, rich with quests and challenges.
HILLSFAR: An incredible fantasy that combines the best of role-playing adventures and fast-paced action games.
Every visit to the city of Hillsfar is a different exhilarating experience. Explore the city, meet its colorful denizens on the streets or in pubs and discover a quest (there are many possible ones).
Transfer your favourite character from the POOL OF RADIANCE or CURSE OF THE AZURE BONDS AD&D FORGOTTEN REALMS computer role-playing games, or create one from scratch. Your quest and the options available to you each game will change to suit your character's speciality (thief, mage, cleric or fighter).
Your quest will keep you constantly on the move. Fight in the arena against raging minotaurs, ill tempered orcs or other evil opponents. Enter different buildings and your maze-running and lock-picking skills will be required. Archery and equestrian events may also be part of your overall quest.
Think fast. Move fast. These mini-games happen in real time!
For both adventure and action, there's no place like Hillsfar!

76778.name: Quake Mission Pack 1: Scourge of Armagon
76778.description:
From the back of the Game

After defeating Shub-Nigguarath, you arrive back at your home base on Earth, but it's not all blue skies and butterflies. Apparently, not all QUAKE forces have been subdued. Chaos ensues as you blast your way through the QUAKE minions and toward the infested gateway. Your only choice is to find the source of the evil and shut it down. Without any hesitation, and with more guts than common sense, you leap into a portal of unknown destination.

76779.name: Fire Emblem: The Sacred Stones
76779.description:
From the back of the box

From the Ashes of a Fallen Kingdom...

The kingdom of Renais lies in ruins, shattered by a sudden invasion from a former ally. Guide the royal heirs, Eirika and Ephraim on their twin quest to rebuild Renais and discover the dark secret behind the war that has torn their homeland apart.

76780.name: Maziacs
76780.description:
User Summary

In Maziacs, the hero must enter a randomly generated maze to find the treasure and bring it back safely to the exit. Along the way, he'll have to fight the dangerous Maziacs, spidery looking monsters which can only be safely killed if the hero has a sword. But also, he'll find help in the form of prisoners who'll show him the way towards the treasure (or the exit if he's already carrying it).

Maziacs was programmed by Don Priestley (who was famous for the huge sprites used in his Spectrum Trapdoor games and Popeye). It was based on an earlier design of his, Mazogs which was a ZX81 game.

76781.name: Twin Blades
76781.description:
From the Bulkypix Website

TwinBlades is a frantic shooter game set in a medieval era with unique manga-like graphics.

Help the nun defeat evil with some heavy zombie-killing action across multiple environments, venture through the city market, the cemetary, a chapel in ruins and the city's outskirts to purge the town of all its living-dead inhabitants.

Buy new skills and powers and upgrade them as you progress day after day. Manage carefully your energy by slicing zombies with your mighty scythe in order to use the destructive powers of your artillery!

76782.name: IL-2 Sturmovik: Birds of Prey
76782.description:
User Summary

IL-2 Sturmovik series hits consoles with this entry. As with the previous games, can be made as easy or as realistic as one chooses.

76783.name: Quake Mission Pack 2: Dissolution of Eternity
76783.description:
From the back of the game

Your journey has led you down a path of no return. The acrid smell of death fills the air. And you know that the road ahead may lead to your grave. But QUAKE, with his insidious, apocalyptic plans, must be crushed. If you fail, evil will shroud the Universe for all eternity.

76784.name: Pokémon Pinball
76784.description:
From the back of the box

Catch 'em all with a pinball!

Discover a whole new way to collect Pokémon - by playing pinball! Hit the targets with your Poké Ball to catch and evolve Pokémon. The better you do, the more rare Pokémon you'll find! Every Pokémon you catch is automatically recorded in your Pokédex - see if you can catch all 150! Some Pokémon appear only on the Red Field or only on the Blue Field, so you'll have to play them both to catch 'em all!

Cartridge contains a rumble pack.

76785.name: R.C. Pro-Am
76785.description:
User Summary

R.C. Pro-AM is an arcade-style racing game for the NES. The player races the red car around the track trying to beat the 3 A.I. opponents to the finish line. The tracks have pick-ups scattered on them the player can pick up to improve the car's stats. Some pick-ups are weapons, while others are upgrades for their car.

The game plays at an isometric (top-down) angle. There are 32 different tracks to play through. The player loses if they ever come in 4th place (dead last), but continues if they come in 1st through 3rd.

76787.name: Dynasty Warriors 3

videogamefranchise.6403: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.37529: 2001–2002 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner

76787.description:
User Summary

Beat 'em up set in classical China during the 3 Kingdoms period. The player assumes the role of various historical figures and fights in battles of hundreds of soldiers.

76788.name: Crazy Taxi 3: High Roller
76788.description:
Crazy Taxi 3: High Roller is the third game in the Crazy Taxi series, and was released for the Xbox and Microsoft Windows, with also an arcade release under the name Crazy Taxi: High Roller.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crazy Taxi 3," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76789.name: Mercenaries 2: World in Flames
76789.description:
User Summary:

"Mercenaries 2" takes the mix of over the top action & sandbox freedom from the first game into a war-torn Venezula. Just like the first game, the player performs missions for various factions, balancing gaining favour with one vs increased animosity with its rivals. Players are given a wide 'sandbox' to play in with missions rarely having one fixed path to completion.The sequel adds a wider variety of vehicles & munitions, together with online co-operative play over XBL or PSN.

A variety of free downloadable content was released, including "player skins" resembling Barak Obama & Sarah Palin.

While the original game was published by LucasArts, this sequel is published by Electronic Arts, the new owners of Pandemic.

76790.name: Tenchu: Wrath of Heaven
76790.description:
From the back of the box

Move like a shadow. Strike like a snake.

After amassing an army of ninjas and lords of darkness, the mysterious Tenrai has begun a quest to conquer 16th-century Japan. Now your master, Lord Gohda, has called upon you - a cunning stealth assassin - to stop Tenrai and his disciples before all is lost.

Live by honour. Kill by stealth.

76791.name: Viking: Battle for Asgard
76791.description:
User Summary:

"Viking: Battle for Asgard" is a third person action game, developed by Creative Assembly, better known for the Total War series.

Based on Norse mythology, the game is set in the realm of Asgard, with the player acting as the champion of the Goddess Freya. The player must unite the Norse tribes against the force of the evil Goddess Hel.

Each level is relatively "open world" with no set structure to the level bar a number of missions. By completing these missions & conquering villages/towns etc, the player gains troops for his army, before facing off against the massed enemy troops in battles straight out of "Lord of the Rings".

The game is played in a third person "over the shoulder" perspective, with a variety of typical 'hack & slash' combos/powers available. At key takedowns, the game switches to a "quick time event" style of gameplay.

76792.name: Anticipation
76792.description:
From the back of the box:

Bored with board games? Tired of pursuing trivia? Had your fill of ethical questions? Then you're ready for ANTICIPATION. This zany, unpredictable, totally wacked-out video board game begins with a giant connect-the-dots puzzle. Suddenly, a video pencil starts connecting the dots and, before you know it, you're in a maddening race against the clock, trying to solve the puzzle. Is it an Igloo? A Penguin? A Pineapple? Whatever it is, you - and all your friends - will have a great time trying to guess what the pencil is drawing. Guess right and you'll get a crack at the really tough puzzles - no dots or clues, just the pencil drawing a picture. Think you're up to it? Then challenge your friends. Or take on the Computer. Either way, this off-the-floor board game will challenge you, excite you and generally drive you crazy for years to come.

76793.name: Inazuma Eleven
76793.description:
Inazuma Eleven (イナズマイレブン）is a role-playing and sports video game for the Nintendo DS developed and published by Level-5.

Source: Wikipedia, "Inazuma Eleven," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76794.name: Izuna: Legend of the Unemployed Ninja
76794.description:
Izuna: Legend of the Unemployed Ninja, known in Japan as Gōma Reifu Den Izuna (降魔霊符伝イヅナ, lit. "Devil-conquering Soul Talisman Legend Izuna") and in Europe as Izuna: The Legend of the Ninja, is a Nintendo DS roguelike game by Success and published by Atlus USA in the United States, and by 505 Games in Europe.

Source: Wikipedia, "Izuna: Legend of the Unemployed Ninja," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76795.name: EverQuest II

videogamehonor.31756: 2003 Game Critics Best Online Multiplayer of the Year Nominee

76795.description:
From Official Website

EverQuest® II is the next generation of massively multiplayer gaming, a huge online world where friends have come together for adventure and community. Featuring breathtaking graphics and a vast, beautiful and dangerous game world to explore, EverQuest II sets the standard for graphical realism as players are immersed in the game's exciting locales and mysterious lands.

76796.name: Track & Field
76796.description:
Track & Field, known in Japan as Hyper Olympics, is a 1983 Olympic-themed arcade game developed and published by Konami.

The arcade version was released in 1983. The simple gameplay, based on quick, repeating, button presses set the basics for sequels and similar games in the genre for the next decades. There were several home versions of the original; the ZX Spectrum and Amstrad CPC versions were only released as part of the Game, Set and Match II compilation in 1988, and are poorly regarded by fans. The NES version was especially well-received, and sold well.

Source: Wikipedia, "Track and Field (arcade game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76797.name: The Goonies II
76797.description:
The Goonies II (グーニーズ2 フラッテリー最後の挑戦, Gūnīzu Tsū: Furatterī Saigo no Chōsen, The Goonies II: The Fratellis' Last Stand) is an adventure game developed and published by Konami for the Nintendo Entertainment System. It was released on March 18, 1987 (1987-03-18) in Japan, November 1987 in North America, and on December 19, 1988 (1988-12-19) in Europe. It is a sequel to the first Famicom Goonies game, which was only available in North America on PlayChoice-10 arcade units. This led some people to believe that it was supposed to be a sequel to the movie The Goonies which was never produced.

The game's story centers on Mikey. His friends, the Goonies, have been kidnapped by the Fratellis, an Italian family of small-time crooks and counterfeiters. Mikey must rescue all six of his friends and free a captured mermaid named Annie who didn't appear in the film.

Source: Wikipedia, "Goonies II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76798.name: Citadel (BBC Micro)

videogameversion.268100: English/European Acorn Electron 'Cassette' edition (Dark Blue Cover)

76798.description:
Not to be confused with the Commodore 64 adventure game Citadel (Commodore 64) by Electric Dreams, nor with the Sinclair QL arcade game by Eidersoft.

Citadel is a computer game released in 1985 for the Acorn Electron and BBC Micro by Superior Software. A platform game with some puzzle solving elements, the game's plot involves finding five crystals hidden in various locations in a large castle, together with areas outside it (including a wasteland, a pyramid, a sea and an island) and returning them to their rightful place.

Citadel was unusual at the time for playing digitised speech before loading the main game (in part to advertise Superior Software's "Speech!" program package), as well as having other special effects advanced for the time, such as splashing water sounds.

Source: Wikipedia, "Citadel (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76799.name: Miss Management
76799.description:
From the Publisher Website

Get ready to manage a team of zany animated coworkers as you step into the shoes of Denise, a young and beleaguered first-time office manager. You'll have to juggle incoming work tasks, keep everyone from getting stressed out, and help the coworkers achieve their goals, from flirting at the watercooler to getting more work done than anyone else! Office politics was never as hilarious as this! From the designers of Diner Dash.

76800.name: We Ski & Snowboard
76800.description:
When skiing, players stand on the Balance Board, and by distributing their weight and using the Wii Remote and Nunchuk as virtual ski poles, simulate the sport of skiing as accurately as possible. When snowboarding, players stand on the Balance Board rotated 90° and use the Wii Remote and Nunchuk to propel themselves forward. Players have the ability to swap between skiing and snowboarding at any time during gameplay. The game can also be played without the Balance Board.

The game world features 7,000 vertical meters of skiing or snowboarding. Besides racing, the game also features different modes such as a School, Slalom Challenge, and Half-pipe in addition to an Enjoy the Resort mode in which up to 4 players may ski or snowboard wherever they want on the slopes. Another thing to do is collect thumbs up by finding or completing various things.

The game makes use of the player's own Miis, in addition to customizable characters created in-game as avatars, and players can earn unlockables such as character apparel and upgraded equipment by completing various goals, such as finding hidden courses, etc. The WiiConnect24 service will make possible the sharing of in-game photos taken by players during their game.

The game features two courses, Jamboree Snow Resort and Mt. Angrio, each which have runs for all skill levels and challenges.

Source: Wikipedia, "We Ski & Snowboard," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76801.name: Trog!
76801.description:
Trog plays somewhat like a Pac-Man clone. The player assumes the role of Rex, Bloop, Spike, or Gwen, small T-Rex dinosaurs (with Styracosaurus-like heads) in the land of "Og", home to the one-eyed cavemen known as the "Trog". Players must pick up all colored eggs lying around the map as the cavemen wander around, attempting to capture and eat them. Luckily, there are plenty of power-ups to help finish the level. Aside from a standard punch attack, these include red flowers that increase the player's speed, ice cubes that freeze all on-screen Trogs and pineapples, which turn the character into a full-grown T-Rex that can temporarily eat his enemies. The multiplayer mode consists of two to four dinos on the same screen competing to get all of his/her same-colored eggs first, and players can either attack or protect each other (though power-ups indiscriminately hurt anyone that's in the way regardless). Unlike Pac-Man, however, the dinos can attack without requiring a power-up, and the mazes are much more open. In fact, in many stages there are no walls at all, so the characters can travel off the edge of the grid-like islands and plunge into the sea if they're not careful. The Trogs can be one-hit punched, to the side of the head, as they approach the screen edge resulting in them diving into the sea, with bonus points rewarded to the player.

There are three different levels of difficulty: Easy, Advanced and Expert. Advanced Mode rewards a 200,000 level bonus and Expert rewards a 400,000 level bonus. As the levels progress, the cavemen become smarter and invent new ways to capture the dinosaurs. They eventually create fire pits and wheels to burn and flatten, respectively, the character and springs to bounce themselves all over the screen. Catapults and transportation chambers in latter stages help evade these attacks, however these are also usable by the Trogs resulting in some tactical gameplay options.

The Trogs themselves are subject to all hazards the player is; they can even be taken out by their own wheels, fire and pits to comic effect.

Source: Wikipedia, "Trog!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76802.name: Trauma Center: Second Opinion

videogamehonor.32703: 2008 British Academy Game Awards Best Innovation of the Year Nominee

76802.description:
[From the back of the box]:

The critically acclaimed medical drama simulation is making a house call on your Wii!

Trauma Center: Second Opinion turns your living room into an O.R.!

Dr. Derek Stiles is back, but he's not the only surgeon on call - Dr. Nozomi Weaver joins the team, bringing along everything the doctor ordered: difficulty modes, new surgical implements like the defibrillator, and an exciting never-before-seen conclusion. So what are you waiting for? If one dose of Trauma Center wasn't enough, it's time you got a Second Opinion!

76803.name: Ticket to Ride
76803.description:
[User Summary]:

Ticket to Ride is based on the board game of the same name. This version takes the action to XBLA. Game play remains unchanged from the base version of the board game. Players draw cards and attempt to collect sets so that they may build train routes.

76804.name: Boffin
76804.description:
Boffin is a platform game released in 1985 by Addictive Games for the Acorn Electron and BBC Micro. The cassette contained two different versions of the game.

After a freak accident, a scientist (the Boffin) is shrunk to only a few centimetres tall. He must navigate through his laboratory to reach the antidote which will restore him to his normal size.

The player controls the Boffin by moving him around the obstacles on the levels. The Boffin can only jump short distances, but he can fall from any height by opening his umbrella to slow his descent to a safe speed. Each level ends when the player touches an owl which is usually located at the bottom of the screen.

* Source: Wikipedia, "Boffin(computer game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76805.name: Rock n' Roll Racing
76805.description:
User summary:

Rock 'n Roll Racing is a racing game developed by Silicon & Synapse. The game was released in 1993 by Interplay for the SNES and Genesis and was later ported to the Gameboy Advance. What makes RnRR different from most racing games, is it's isometric point of view, the sci-fi theme, the music and the use of weapons.

To beat the game the player has to compete on different planets in a series of tournaments (seasons). Each planet has its own graphical style and opponent. In every race, four racers are competing in a four-lap race. Racers placed 1st, 2nd or 3rd receive points for the championship. When a racing season is over, the player has to have collected a certain amount of points to advance to the next class. After two classes the player can advance to the next planet.

Each car has a torpedo-like weapon to shoot opponents in front and a mine-like weapon for cars behind. Apart from that each car has a nitro, which gives a temporary boost in speed. All these are limited in supply. Each lap the weapons and nitro's are resupplied. The player can upgrade the type of weapons and amount of ammo on his vehicle using the money earned by winning races. Additional money can be earned by destroying opponents, lapping opponents and finding money on the track. On certain planets new cars are for sale, but buying a new car means resetting the weapon upgrades..

The game features the songs:
- Bad to the Bone,
- Paranoid,
- The Peter Gunn theme,
- Born to be Wild,
- Highway star.

Other notable features:
- Two player mode (also in the tournament),
- Three difficulty levels,
- Password system - A password is generated containing the exact status of player.
- 7 Different drivers each with their own skills, regarding jumping, acceleration, top speed and cornering.

76807.name: DDRMAX Dance Dance Revolution
76807.description:
From the back of the box

Revolutionay to the Max!

Straight from the arcades, DDRMAX Dance Dance Revolution debuts on the PlayStation 2 computer entertainment system. Step into the spotlight and put your skills to the test as you move to the groove. Experience maximum dancing with all-new songs and game modes, high-energy pulsating music and stunning graphics. The evolution of the revolution awaits you!

76808.name: General Chaos
76808.description:
[From the back of the box]:

COLOSSAL DESTRUCTION AND MAYHEM

Command the armies of General Chaos against General Havoc's troops in this multi-player action game of brute strength and awesome firepower.

76809.name: Beach-Head

videogamehonor.29113: 1984 Golden Joystick Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee

76809.description:
Gameplay consists of several varying stages in which the player must control various vehicles including warships and tanks in order to defeat an enemy fleet, break through enemy beach defences and destroy an enormous gun-emplacement to win the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Beach Head," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76810.name: Last Call: The Bartender Game
76810.description:
The customers are restless, the drink orders are piling up, and the bartenders won’t mix drinks until they have the right bottles in hand! Pass the bottles from one bartender to another until someone can fill an order. But beware, if the bartender has too many bottles, they’ll water down your cocktail with ice cubes. Get the bartenders to fill your drink orders and collect the fewest ice cubes along the way. Find out who runs the best bar when it’s time for “Last Call”!

A fast-paced game for 2 to 5 players. Although themed to mixing alcoholic drinks, it is simple enough for an eight-year-old to play. Continual involvement for all players, and language-independent components. Rulebook includes English, French, and German rules. A good pick-up or end-of-session game.

- publisher

76811.name: Beach-Head II
76811.description:
Beach-Head II featured the player pursuing the eponymous Dictator in several ways. There are four levels in the game. In the first level, called Attack, the player deploys soldiers along a path with walls to cover him from the dictator's gun. The objective is to destroy the gun. The second level involves rescuing the prisoners from deadly obstacles by clearing them with a gun. The third level's objective is to escape from the area by flying a helicopter with the prisoners out of the dictator's fortress. Finally the player and the dictator face off, on opposite cliffs, separated by water. To defeat him, the player must make him to fall in the water by throwing knives at him. He tries to do the same to the player.

Source: Wikipedia, "Beach Head II: The Dictator Strikes Back," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

76812.name: Oni

videogamefranchise.6403: Platinum Range (Best Selling PlayStation Games, PAL)

videogamehonor.31506: 1999 Game Critics Best Action/Adventure Game of the Year Winner

76812.description:
[User Summary]:

Oni is a third person shooter developed by Bungie. It was notable for its combination of unarmed martial arts action and shooting into a single game system.

The game has a distinctive look that draws influence from Japanese anime films such as Ghost in the Shell.

76813.name: Indianapolis 500 Legends
76813.description:
[From the back of the case]:
